intro: Achyronia latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract achyronia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
